column4: Quick question: if I've got a MacBook with a Core 2 Duo 2.16GHz (not sure of the exact model number) and a PC with an E4300, am I better off with the 32-bit or 64-bit version of Ubuntu? I know both'll work.

Quick question: if I've got a MacBook with a Core 2 Duo 2.16GHz (not sure of the exact model number) and a PC with an E4300, am I better off with the 32-bit or 64-bit version of Ubuntu? I know both'll work.
if you do heavy number crunching(cinelerra, video encoding, simulations, 3d...etc) then 64 bit. if you're using it as a desktop and want it easy to use 32 bit
only 3? you have tried nothing until you try HURD
